abstract: Russia plans to sell as much as 15 percent of OAO Rosneft, its biggest oil producer, as the government seeks to raise 1.8 trillion rubles ($59 billion) in asset sales in the next five years to help balance the budget, Bloomberg News reported.

lead_paragraph: Russia plans to sell as much as 15 percent of Rosneft, its biggest oil producer, as the government seeks to raise 1.8 trillion rubles ($59 billion) in asset sales in the next five years to help balance the budget, Bloomberg News reported.

headline.main: Russia to Sell 15% of Rosneft to Help Balance Budget
